total_revenue.context: Net sales increased 9% to $155.7 billion in the first quarter, compared with $143.3 billion in first quarter 2024. Excluding the $1.4 billion unfavorable impact from year-over-year changes in foreign exchange rates throughout the quarter, net sales increased 10% compared with first quarter 2024.
total_revenue.fx_impact: Foreign exchange rates had an unfavorable impact of $1.4 billion on net sales growth.

net_sales.context: North America segment sales increased 8% year-over-year to $92.9 billion.

operating_expenses.context: Operating expenses for North America were $87.046 billion in Q1 2025.

operating_income.context: North America segment operating income was $5.8 billion, compared with $5.0 billion in first quarter 2024.

net_sales.context: International segment sales increased 5% year-over-year to $33.5 billion, or increased 8% excluding changes in foreign exchange rates.

operating_expenses.context: Operating expenses for International were $32.496 billion in Q1 2025.

operating_income.context: International segment operating income was $1.0 billion, compared with $0.9 billion in first quarter 2024.

net_sales.context: AWS segment sales increased 17% year-over-year to $29.3 billion.

operating_expenses.context: Operating expenses for AWS were $17.720 billion in Q1 2025.

operating_income.context: AWS segment operating income was $11.5 billion, compared with $9.4 billion in first quarter 2024.

net_sales.context: Consolidated net sales increased 9% to $155.7 billion in Q1 2025.

operating_expenses.context: Consolidated operating expenses were $137.262 billion in Q1 2025, compared to $128.006 billion in Q1 2024.

operating_income.context: Operating income increased to $18.4 billion in the first quarter, compared with $15.3 billion in first quarter 2024.

total_expenses.context: Total operating expenses increased from $128.006 billion in Q1 2024 to $137.262 billion in Q1 2025.
key_factors: One-time charges related to historical customer returns
Costs to receive inventory pulled forward ahead of tariffs

Technology_and_content.context: Technology and infrastructure expenses were $22.994 billion.

Marketing.context: Sales and marketing expenses were $9.763 billion.

General_and_administrative.context: General and administrative expenses were $2.628 billion.

Other.context: Other operating expense (income), net was $308 million.

Stock_based_Compensation.context: Total stock-based compensation expense was $3.689 billion in Q1 2025.

operating_income.context: Operating income increased to $18.4 billion in Q1 2025.

net_income.context: Net income increased to $17.1 billion in the first quarter, compared with $10.4 billion in first quarter 2024.

eps.context: Diluted earnings per share was $1.59, compared with $0.98 in first quarter 2024.

free_cash_flow.context: Free cash flow decreased to $25.9 billion for the trailing twelve months.

operating_cash_flow.context: Operating cash flow increased 15% to $113.9 billion for the trailing twelve months.

free_cash_flow_less_equipment_and_other_.context: Metric not explicitly highlighted in summary bullet points.

capital_expenditures.context: Cash CapEx was $24.3 billion in Q1 2025 (Transcript).

total_employees.context: Employees (full-time and part-time; excludes contractors & temporary personnel) increased to 1,560,000 in Q1 2025, up 3% year-over-year.

market_position.description: Amazon continues to innovate in AI, delivery speed, and customer experience.
initiatives: Introduced Alexa+, next-generation personal assistant free with Prime.
Introduced Saks on Amazon luxury shopping.
Announced $4 billion investment to expand rural delivery network.
goals: Expand delivery network to rural areas.
examples: Fastest delivery ever for Prime members.
Customers saved over $500 million across spring deal events.

innovation.description: Advancing AI with new models and infrastructure.
initiatives: Trainium2 chips and Bedrock model expansion.
goals: Provide flexible and cost-effective AI training and inference.
Broadband access to rural areas via Kuiper.
examples: Ocelot chip reduces resources for quantum error correction by up to 90%.

initiatives: Joint venture for James Bond film franchise.
Expansion of selection with brands like Michael Kors and The Ordinary.
examples: Reacher Season 3 drew 54.6 million viewers in first 19 days.
New 'Buy for Me' feature for products from other brands.

social_initiatives.description: Focus on safety and workplace environment.
initiatives: Ranked No. 2 on LinkedIn’s U.S. Top Companies list.
Improved recordable incident rate by 34% over past five years.
examples: Lost-time incident rate improved by 65% across operations over past five years.

revenue_growth.expectation: Net sales are expected to be between $159.0 billion and $164.0 billion, or to grow between 7% and 11% compared with second quarter 2024.
revenue_growth.constant_currency_growth: Includes approximately 10 basis points unfavorable impact from foreign exchange rates.

core_trends: Investments in AI and AWS infrastructure.

revenue.context: Net sales expected to be between $159.0 billion and $164.0 billion.

operating_income.context: Operating income is expected to be between $13.0 billion and $17.5 billion.

operating_environment_challenges: Potential impact of tariffs and trade policies.

stock_based_compensation_expense.context: Total stock-based compensation expense was $3.689 billion in Q1 2025.

ww_shipping_costs.context: Worldwide shipping costs were $22.495 billion in Q1 2025.

common_shares_outstanding.context: 10.613 billion shares outstanding as of March 31, 2025.
